word: Why should I complain? So many times has the Lord raised me up from sickness, so wonderfully has He sustained me, that I can never doubt. I have so many unmistakable evidences of His special blessings, that I could not possibly doubt. He gives me freedom to speak His truth before large numbers of people.-- Letter 86, March 8, 1906, to Elder G. I. Butler, president of the Southern Union Conference.
